meanings.definition: A strong wooden or metal post with a pointed end, driven into the ground to support a plant, form part of a fence, mark a boundary, etc.
meanings.sent1: Dad hammered the stake into the soil to keep the tomato plant upright.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a stake to secure the fence around the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the stake for a tree and tried to climb it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a stake firmly planted in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The stake stood tall, a silent guardian of the garden.

meanings.definition: A sum of money or something else of value gambled on the outcome of a risky game or venture.
meanings.sent1: He placed a small stake on the poker table, hoping for a win.
meanings.sent2: The high roller risked a large stake in the casino.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the stake of chips, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation was at stake in the high-stakes negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The stake on the line made the game thrilling and nerve-wracking.

meanings.definition: A share or interest in a business or undertaking.
meanings.sent1: She bought a stake in the company, excited to be part of the venture.
meanings.sent2: Investors were eager to acquire a stake in the promising startup.
meanings.sent3: The stakeholder meeting turned into a lively discussion about future plans.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the project was evident in his stake in its success.
meanings.sent5: Owning a stake in the business gave her a sense of pride and responsibility.
